# Government Tender Announcement

## General Information

* **Tender Title**: Duty of Care, International Security, and Medical Risk Service Provider
* **Reference Number**: cb-714-18867048
* **Publication Date**: November 22, 2024
* **Tender Closing Date**: December 6, 2024, 13:00:00 EST
* **Expected Contract Start Date**: Not specified
* **Expected Contract End Date**: Not specified
* **Tender Status**: Open

## Service Description

The successful bidder will be required to provide duty of care services to Export Development Canada (EDC) employees and assignees both internationally and domestically. This includes:

* Preparing EDC employees and assignees for potential incidents through timely digital learning and training
* Providing pre-travel advice and readiness, location risk guides, and cultural tips
* Assigning employees and assignees to various countries, as specified by EDC (currently listed countries include Africa, Americas, Asia, Europe, and Oceania)
* Providing customized advice from medical and security experts and proprietary risk information to help EDC mitigate unforeseen incidents
* Informing EDC of its exposure during a crisis
* Providing crisis communications with impacted people using two-way, location-based communication channels and incident-based notifications
* Offering live, 24/7 assistance for EDC employees when required, both domestically and internationally
* Providing both manager and employee interfaces to access critical information remotely at all times

## Notice and Attachments

To view the full tender notice and attachment, please visit the following links:

* English: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/52495/acan-24-835-en_0.pdf
* French: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/52495/pac-24-835-fr_fra.pdf

## Contact Information

* **Contact Name**: Patrick Sheehan
* **Email**: solicitations@edc.ca
* **Phone**: (343) 630-5782

Please note that the list of countries may be updated at any time, and the successful bidder must be capable of providing services for any country. The tender description mentions the procurement method as a request for proposal and states that the trades agreement applicable to this notice includes the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA).
